gsonpath

Annotation Type AutoGsonArrayStreamer


  • @Retention(value=SOURCE)
@Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface AutoGsonArrayStreamer
    A class annotated with this annotation will automatically generate a Gson GsonArrayStreamer at compile time.

    The generated class is useful when wanting to read a JSON array directly from an input stream without creating a wrapper class which exists only to allow a Gson TypeAdapter to read it properly.

    It also has more advanced features such as allowing streaming the array elements one-by-one, or in a segmented fashion.

    To use this annotation correctly without issues, the annotated class must be an interface which extends the GsonArrayStreamer interface. If these preconditions are not met, a compiler error will be thrown.

    For more information, see the GsonArrayStreamer documentation.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      boolean consumeReaderFully
      Typically Gson validates whether a stream has been read in its entirety, and throws an exception if it has not.
      char flattenDelimiter
      The delimiter used to flatten Json nested structures into a single POJO.
      java.lang.String rootField
      By leaving value blank, it is implied that the root of the json is an array instead of an object.

    • Element Detail

      • rootField

        public abstract java.lang.String rootField
        By leaving value blank, it is implied that the root of the json is an array instead of an object.

        For more information as to how this property works, see the AutoGsonAdapter documentation.

        Default:
        ""

      • flattenDelimiter

        public abstract char flattenDelimiter
        The delimiter used to flatten Json nested structures into a single POJO.

        By default this is set to using the '.' character. If required you can override this to using a different character, and all the fields within this class will use this delimiter instead.

        Default:
        46

      • consumeReaderFully

        public abstract boolean consumeReaderFully
        Typically Gson validates whether a stream has been read in its entirety, and throws an exception if it has not.

        When using the 'rootField' property, we can yield a performance gain by ignoring the rest of the stream as soon as the specified Json Array has been read.

        The downsides to this is that the stream is now in an invalid state. By default we want to ensure that the stream is read correctly to maintain good compatibility with Gson. However if you use the streamer directly on the input stream, you can deliberately disable this functionality and reap some level of performance gains.

        Default:
        true
